Key Match Events: Francisco Lindor hit a walk-off home run in the ninth inning to end the no-hitter threat and ignite a six-run inning as the Mets claimed a 6-2 win over the Blue Jays.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Carlos Mendoza emphasized the importance of having good at-bats and eventually something good would happen.
Lindor stated that the hit felt really good and lifted the vibes in the dugout.
Lindor mentioned that the hit was special for all of them, remembering the ones lost on September 11.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Mets won their fifth straight series win and have a one-game lead on the Braves for the third National League Wild Card spot.
This was the fifth time in franchise history that the Mets won a game after being no-hit through eight innings, with the last time coming on July 31, 1983.
The six runs in the ninth were also the most by a team that didn't have any hits through eight frames in the expansion era (since 1961).
